channel.title: Mac os x - Experience
channel.description:
I was wondering if anyone has experience of mac os x running and a hosting a private server that will be able to guide me with applications and so forth that I will be needing.
I plan on purchasing a windows computer soon just for the simple fact it be easier to learn how to code on, and its better overall for games I like to play. But in the mean time it be cool if I could get some help and figure out to do things on a mac.
Like how do i fix things like this?, [IMG]http://i61.tinypic.com/wcgzfq.png[/img]
And files downloaded that would show up on windows but instead are just document files on a mac.[IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/apfn1v.png[/img][IMG]http://i59.tinypic.com/apfn1v.png[/img]

item.title: Mac os x - Experience

item.description:
@da_real_hype wrote:

rscangel had .sh files. export JAVA_HOME=/home/java/jdk1.6.0_14 ant compile
Go.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac os x - Experience
item.dc:creator: @EazY EazY
item.description:
@EazY wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:2, topic:546545”]from experience, programming on a unix machine is much easier than on windows

you are trying to execute a batch script (which is a proprietary scripting language on windows) which is an unknown format on OS X (or any other non-windows operating system for that matter). you could convert the scripts to shell pretty easily. in fact, you don’t even need the scripts on OS X, you just need a terminal and apache ant.[/quote]
Can you teach me how to convert the scripts to shell and set up apache ant on mac, i’m using version 10.6.8 I also got a version 10.7.5 that allows me to download jdk7 unlike my other mac.

Read full topic

item.title: Mac os x - Experience
item.dc:creator: @imthenull imthenull
item.description:
@imthenull wrote:

from experience, programming on a unix machine is much easier than on windows

you are trying to execute a batch script (which is a proprietary scripting language on windows) which is an unknown format on OS X (or any other non-windows operating system for that matter). you could convert the scripts to shell pretty easily. in fact, you don’t even need the scripts on OS X, you just need a terminal and apache ant.

Read full topic
